testcase.brief: Verify the radius traffic can be routed via VPN tunnel successfully
testcase.description:
Pre-Condition: -config a remote CVG, there is several LANs behind it -there are some services in CVG's LANs -BR setup VPN connection with the CVG -BR acts as a radius client(NAS), the radius server is behind CVG -setup a ssid using this radius client
Test Procedure: -STA connects to ssid, trigger the 802.1x auth -check the radius msg by fe debug, should go through vpn tunnel -check the server side, msg should be received by syslog server cor

step.desc: configure mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vpc1.vlan}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask ${br.route.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

-v "security-object lan1" -v "security-object lan1 security protocol-suite 802.1x" -v "security-object lan1 security aaa radius primary ${cvg1.cvg.lan.ip} shared-secret aerohive" -v "security-object lan1 default-user-profile-attr 20"

step.desc: 2. Set one user-profile and define the attribute x, 3. Set the eth1 mode as bridge-access and bind the attribute to it 4. Bind the security-object to the eth1.
step.telnet: -v "user-profile lan1 qos-policy def-user-qos vlan-id ${br1.vpc1.vlan} attribute 20" -v "interface eth1 mode bridge-access" -v "interface eth1 security-object lan1" -v "interface eth1 mac-learning enable" -v "_debug auth all" -v "clear log all"

step.desc: config cvg as a radius server
step.telnet: -v "hive ${hive.name}" -v "interface mgt0 hive ${hive.name}" -v "user-group autotest" -v "user ${radius.username}" -v "user ${radius.username} pass ${radius.passwd}" -v "user ${radius.username} group autotest" -v "aaa radius-server local db local" -v "aaa radius-server local user-group autotest" -v "aaa radius-server local nas ${br1.br.mgt0.ip} shared-key aerohive" -v "aaa radius-server local enable"

step.desc: prepare config file with correct username and wrong password
step.ssh: -v "echo -e \" ctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant \\n ap_scan=0 \\n network={ \\n key_mgmt=IEEE8021X \\n eap=MD5 \\n identity=\\x22${radius.username}\\x22 \\n password=\\x22${radius.passwd}\\x22 \\n eapol_flags=0 \\n } \" > /tmp/wpa_supplicant.conf"

step.desc: set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side

step.log-match: -c -i "RADIUS: eap auth for STA=${br1.vpc1.tif.mac} user=${radius.username} successfully with type md5"
-c -i "RADIUS: The RADIUS server accepted user '${radius.username}' through the NAS at ${br1.br.mgt0.ip}"
